page.shortlink: api a5 parry from string function
page.description: Creates a property array from a CR-LF delimited string. Returns the size of the array.
page.prototype: dim result as n = a5_parray_from_string(C array_name, C format_string, C string, P vars)

argument.name: array_name
argument.description: Name of the array to create. Must be a valid Xbasic variable name.

argument.name: format_string
argument.description: Defines how to map the data in the string to the property array. For more information about how to define the format, see [<array>.initialize_properties()].

argument.name: string
argument.description: The data to populate the property array.

argument.name: vars
argument.description: The namespace in which the array will be created. Pass in *[xb:local_variables()]* to create the array at the local scope. See examples below.

return.name: result
return.description: Returns the size of the array.

discussion.p: The *[xb:a5_parray_from_string()]* function creates and populates a pointer array with data from a CR-LF delimited string. The format definition describes how the data in the string maps to properties in the array.

section.example:
dim obj as p dim format as c = "Name|Age:N|Position" dim str as c = <<%string% Stephanie|23|Sales Joanne|45|Development Rita|55|President %string%
? a5_parray_from_string("people",format,str,obj) = 3
? obj.people[2] = Age = 45 Name = "Joanne" Position = "Development"

description.p: To create the array in the local variable space, pass [local_variables()] as the fourth argument:

link.link: api objects array initialize properties function
